title: Neumann Boundary Condition
subtitle: Defining the Gradients on the Boundary of the Problem Domain
about:
The Neumann boundary condition is the second type of boundary condition
that defines the gradients on the border of the problem domain (the
gradient at a spot along the border describes how much the value across
the boundary changes). In the following simulation, you can set heat
fluxes through different borders and see how this boundary condition
will affect the temperature distribution inside the box.
